content.description: This is your brief intro to crack climbing in the Douglas State Forest. Sit start on the low blocky jugs in the obvious, vertical crack feature with your legs beneath the little overhang. Move straight up the crack on good holds.This is a fun one to do as an eliminate and only use jams (although it may hurt).
content.location: It is on the "Neighbor Boulder" right next to the "Ladder Boulder". On the south-facing side, this climbs the obvious, vertical hand crack.

content.description: Sit start on the arete beyond the ladder and blank face. Start with a good sidepull and adjacent two finger pocket. Take on a line of good edges to the top. Make a somewhat powerful move to hit the first rail, and then work up through two more good edges before topping out. This is an awesome line on some of the only holds on the entire boulder.
content.location: It is on the "Ladder Boulder." Walk past the ladder and the blank face. As you start to round the arete, you should see a set of good edges.

content.description: These are a pair of twin glacial erratic boulders right along the Basin Marsh Trail on the way to the Titanic Boulder. Most of their routes are very difficult, and some have yet to be cleaned. Only two routes have been established so far, both on the easy side, but both have potential for at least V8 or higher.
